channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Collapsing wall, 26th March
item.description:
The small retainer wall on the honeybourne line opposite the play area has started to collapse and crack with the weight of the trees and soil.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Just try drive to the masts on Cleeve hill you canâ€™t miss the awful state of the road., 25th March

item.title: Damage to road signage & college walls, 25th March
item.description:
Silver & black paint has been daubed over the no-entry sign, street name & the college walls. Appreciate the walls aren't ours but the street furniture is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Naunton Way, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enquiry Acknowledgement - Enquiry 22040673, 25th March
item.description:
Team, reference this previous log Web Reference: 5578436 Enquiry Number: 22040673 Issue: General Signs Issues Location: The 'Give way to oncoming vehicles from the opposite direction' is missing from the Naunton Way junction outside Naunton Park School. Amplifying the risk to road users of this poorly though through the blind junction. Site: NAUNTON LANE The fault still exists, yet has disappeared from the list.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Naunton Way, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The wall on the honeybourne line with a the high slope and trees has cracks, 25th March
item.description:
Walking towards the road. Ridge and train station on the path. The small wall to the left has cracks and is falling down, a possible potential for collapsing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birdlip Road, Birdlip, Cotswold

item.title: Discarded hose pipe, 25th March
item.description:
A length of yellow hosepipe has been discarded on the grass verge adjacent to the entrance to a footpath over a stream. It has been there for several weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Merlin Way, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor reinstatement, 25th March
item.description:
Recent work by Tellent OBO OpenReach it seems has left yet another larger armac infill where there used to be cobblestones. Where are the cobblestones that were removed. The usual buck-passing is happening. Bottom line is that every time this area is worked on, cobblestones are / have been removed. Why can't this be fixed up properly. People are utterly fed up with teh "that'll do" approach to Highways maintenance, with nobody seeming to care about doing a job properly. CAn this small area be reinstated with cobblestones please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Ashford Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
